value:
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But if we cease to consider the plays 
            <choice>
              <sic>separetly</sic>
              <corr>separately</corr>
            </choice>, but</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>scra, ble</sic>
              <corr>scramble</corr>
            </choice> them together as one common attempt; </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">then we are able to make them serve as sketches for one </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">masterpiece. And the darkness in which these plays</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lie helps the endeavour to 
            <choice>
              <sic>conveive</sic>
              <corr>conceive</corr>
            </choice> of that </l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">many nameless 
            <choice>
              <sic>worjers</sic>
              <corr>workers</corr>
            </choice> ; and many private people</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">were pressing their weight were discharging their</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">emotion into that vast cauldron of seething matter which </l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">at last <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wsha" key="Shakespeare, William">Shakespeare</rs> struck out into his plays.</l>
